Dear Mr. Lingle:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204 6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4149 Resident nutrition.
Section (1) A licensee shall provide a minimum of 3 nutritious edible meals
Description daily unless medically contraindicated and documented.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff do not allow food to youth who are sleeping during
mealtimes. One youth was denied food on 2/24/23 and 2/26/23.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth B uses the pronoun they/their.
2

Complainant was contacted via email on March 3, 2023, and
reported they had no further information.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
1, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 1. Youth A
answered questions having to do with other allegations regarding
this investigation but refused to answer any other questions and
walked out of the room.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
1, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 1. Youth B
reported not getting lunch one day because they were in their
room crying. Youth B stated Staff 3 cooked lunch and gave Youth
B’s lunch to another youth. Youth B stated they asked for lunch
and Staff 3 told them no. Youth B stated they asked to make
something else, and Staff 3 told them no.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
1, 2023. Therapist denied Youth B ever saying they were denied
a meal by staff. Therapist reported working with Youth B on food
issues as Youth B has been stealing food and snacks.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
2, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 1. Youth C denied
meals or snacks ever being withheld from youth by staff. Youth C
reported if a youth is not at the facility or does not want to eat staff
save whatever is for that meal for the youth. Youth C stated youth
can always make a sandwich as well.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
March 2, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 1.
Supervisor denied being aware of any staff withholding food from
any youth. Supervisor reported if a youth misses a meal, the meal
is saved for the youth, or the youth can have a substitute meal.
Supervisor reported the substitute meal is either a meat or peanut
butter and jelly sandwich. Supervisor stated fruits and vegetables
are always available and there are three snacks a day for the
youth. Supervisor stated if a youth has the alternative meal the
youth can make the sandwich or staff will make the sandwich.
Supervisor reported Youth B has been saying they are being
denied food and has been trying to steal snacks.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
14, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 2. Youth D
described if a youth misses a meal, staff will save the meal on a
3

tray for the youth to eat later. Youth D stated if the meal is not
saved, because certain food cannot be left out, then an alternative
meal is provided. Youth D reported the alternative meal is a
sandwich and veggies. Youth D stated youth can make the
sandwich or staff will make the sandwich. Youth D reported Youth
B has been recently stealing other youth’s meals and snacks.
Youth D denied ever having a meal withheld by staff.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
14, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 2. Staff 3 stated if
a youth misses a meal because they are sleeping or offsite the
meal is saved in a container or wrapped up in foil for the youth to
eat later. Staff 3 reported if the meal cannot be saved for later
then an alternative meal is provided to the youth. Staff 3 stated
the alternative meal is a meat or peanut butter and jelly sandwich
with fruit or vegetables. Staff 3 denied Youth B ever being denied
a meal.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
14, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 2. Staff 1 stated if
a youth misses a meal because they are sleeping or refusing to
eat, the meal is saved on a plate for the youth to eat later. Staff 1
reported there was a time Youth B slept through dinner but when
they woke up ate a porkchop. Staff 1 denied being aware of
Youth B or any other youth being withheld a meal by staff. Staff 1
stated an alternative meal is always offered to youth as well as
three snacks a day.
DHHS Worker 1 and 2 did not have any findings in the
investigation.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as Youth C, Youth D,
Supervisor, Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 report meals being saved
for youth if a youth is sleeping or misses a meal. Information
provided in all these interviews indicate an alternative meal along
with fruits and vegetables being available to youth as well.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
4

Allegation A month ago, one staff member dragged a youth who was
restrained.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth B uses the pronoun they/their.
Complainant was contacted via email on March 3, 2023, and
reported they had no further information.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
1, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 1. Youth A denied
being in a restraint with Supervisor. Youth A described an
incident where she ran to her bedroom, sat behind the bedroom
door crying and was trying to push the door closed. Youth A
stated Supervisor did not drag her but held the sleeve on her arm
and moved her from behind the door. Youth A reported Staff 1
was standing at the door when this incident occurred. Youth A
stated, “I don’t have anything to say about Supervisor, he is a
good staff.” Youth A refused to answer any more questions and
left the room.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
1, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 1. Youth B
reported Supervisor restrained Youth A and dragged Youth A to
her bedroom. Youth B stated Supervisor restrained Youth A
because he thought she had a weapon in her hand. Youth B
denied seeing the restraint occur but stated they could hear it from
their bedroom.
Director was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
1, 2023. Director denied Supervisor being in a restraint with
Youth A. Director reported there is no incident report for a
restraint and Supervisor is very hesitant to place the youth in a
restraint. Director stated he spoke with Youth A three times, and
Youth A never reported being restrained by Supervisor.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
2, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 1. Youth C denied
having any concerns with staff. Youth C stated she feels safe at
the facility, and nothing has happened with staff to make her not
feel safe.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
March 2, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 1.
Supervisor denied restraining Youth A or dragging Youth A down
the hallway. Supervisor could not recall a time Youth A was
5

behind her bedroom door and holding the sleeve on her arm to
move her out from behind the door. Supervisor stated, “I know the
rules, and I just wouldn’t drag a kid.”
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
14, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 2. Youth D could
not recall Supervisor restraining Youth A. Youth D could not recall
Supervisor restraining any youth.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
14, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 2. Staff 3 denied
ever seeing Supervisor restrain or drag Youth A. Staff 3 recalled
a time Youth A ran into her bedroom and Staff 1 held the door
open to make sure Youth A was safe.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
14, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 2. Staff 1 denied
ever seeing Supervisor restrain or drag Youth A. Staff 1 stated
Supervisor entered Youth A’s bedroom to check and see if Youth
A had something they were not supposed to have in their pocket.
Staff 1 stated she stood in the doorway and watched Youth A
show her pockets to Supervisor which contained a MP3 Player.
Documents Reviewed:
• Supervisor’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary
record and Supervisor completed the required Handle with
Care training on 11/28/2022.
• Search through MiSACWIS did not show any incident
reports of Supervisor restraining Youth A.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of February 13, 2023, for the facility’s West hallway
was reviewed. The video shows Youth A run into her bedroom
and Supervisor follow Youth A. Supervisor stands in Youth A’s
doorway and is heard asking Youth A what she is holding, tells her
whatever she has in her hand she needs to give up because
Supervisor believes it is a weapon. Staff 1 walks down the hall
and stands in the doorway while Supervisor enters Youth A’s
bedroom. Supervisor can be heard saying, “You need to hand
over whatever you’re holding.” Youth A can be heard saying, “I
don’t have anything, I already gave up the rocks, they are in the
office.” Staff 1 continues to stand in the hallway while Supervisor
can be heard talking with Youth A. The incident lasts
approximately five minutes before Supervisor can be seen leaving
Youth A’s bedroom and Staff 1 following down the hall.
6

Analysis The facility is found in compliance as staff and youth interviews,
as well as video does not show Supervisor restraining or dragging
Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv)Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A staff member is emotionally abusive toward the youth and
purposely triggers the youth.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth B uses the pronoun they/their.
Complainant was contacted via email on March 3, 2023, and
reported they had no further information.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
1, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 1. Youth A entered
the room to be interviewed and wanted to know why she was
there. DHHS Worker 1 explained there were some questions for
her regarding a restraint. Youth A stated she did not want to talk
and stated DHHS Worker 1, and this worker were “triggering her.”
Youth A refused to answer any more questions and left the room.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
1, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 1. Youth B
reported Staff 1 brings up Youth B’s past to “trigger” them. Youth
B stated Staff 1 has said, “Is this what your mom would really
want, is this going to get you out of here, and I’m having the best
day ever during bad times.” Youth B stated those statements are
“triggers” for them. Youth B reported Supervisor told Youth D she
was useless because she would not shovel the snow during a
snowstorm.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
2, 2023. Therapist stated Youth B gets mad because Staff 1
7

holds them accountable. Therapist reported working with Youth B
in sessions on what a “trigger” is and what that means. Therapist
stated there have been group sessions with the youth at the
facility to talk about the emotions of being upset versus being
“triggered.” Therapist denied ever hearing staff say something
inappropriate to a youth. Therapist reported staff use reality
statements with the youth when talking about the youth’s actions
and consequences.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
2, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 1. Youth C
reported Youth B does not like Staff 1 because Staff 1 tells Youth
B what to do. Youth C said, “that is Staff 1’s job and Youth B does
not like it.” Youth C denied ever hearing any staff say abusive
comments to any youth.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
March 2, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 1.
Supervisor denied making comments or hearing staff make
comments to youth that are abusive or inappropriate. Supervisor
described staff making reality statements to the youth and youth
say it is “triggering” to them. Supervisor explained reality
statements as saying to the youth, “if you do this behavior, this will
happen.” Supervisor stated it is staff pointing out the youth’s
behavior and possible consequence. Supervisor reported two
days ago asking Youth D to shovel along with all the youth at the
facility. Supervisor stated he was also shoveling. Supervisor
reported Youth D told Supervisor shoveling was beneath her.
Supervisor stated he reminded Youth D she was working on her
GED and needed to complete her GED, or she would be doing
grunt work, meaning shoveling. Supervisor denied telling Youth D
she was useless.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
14, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 2. Youth D
reported all the staff at the facility “trigger” the youth. Youth D
stated staff will bring up the past and it makes her upset. Youth D
gave the example of staff saying, “remember when you did that
last time and what it led to or what you are doing is why you are
here.” Youth D stated Supervisor forced her to shovel snow when
there was a snowstorm. Youth D reported while she was
shoveling the snow Supervisor told her that is why she needed to
go to school and get a diploma. Youth D described Supervisor as
rude and “triggering.”
8

Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
14, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 2. Staff 3 denied
ever hearing Supervisor or a staff say anything abusive toward a
youth. Staff 3 stated no youth have reported to her staff saying
anything abusive.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
14, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 2. Staff 1 stated
reality statements are said to the youth and the youth say they are
being “triggered.” Staff 1 gave the example of telling Youth B their
worker would not like them breaking into the office to get a knife.
Staff 1 reported the reality statements are general statements to
the youth stating if you do this than this will happen. Staff 1
denied making or hearing staff make any abusive comments to
any of the youth.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 1 completed the required Handle with Care
training on 11/28/2022.
• Supervisor’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary
record and Supervisor completed the required Handle with
Care training on 11/28/2022.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of February 13, 2023, for the facility’s West hallway
and of February 24, 2023, in the kitchen was reviewed. In the
kitchen video Staff 1 can be heard telling Youth B if they hit staff
with the stove burner what the consequences will be. Staff 1 can
also be heard telling Youth B if they were to climb in the cupboard,
they could get hurt on the metal drawer slides. In the video from
the hallway Supervisor can be heard telling Youth A to give up
what she is holding on to or she will earn a negative. Both videos
combined are approximately 11 minutes. There are no abusive
comments made by staff heard on camera.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as the interviews with Youth A,
Youth B, Youth C and Youth D describe the “triggering”
statements staff are saying as staff pointing out how the youths’
actions will result in certain consequences. The examples
provided by all of the youth were not abusive statements.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4160 Emergency restraint.
Section (1) The use of emergency restraint as a lifesaving response for a
Description youth will be limited to:
9

(a) An emergency response to protect the youth or others from
an unanticipated or severely aggressive behavior that places the
youth or others at serious threat of violence or injury if no
immediate intervention occurs.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Another staff member conducted an unwarranted restraint on a
youth.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth B uses the pronoun they/their.
Complainant was contacted via email on March 3, 2023, and
reported they had no further information.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
1, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 1. Youth A
answered questions having to do with other allegations regarding
this investigation but refused to answer any other questions and
walked out of the room.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
1, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 1. Youth B
reported Staff 1 restrained them in the kitchen, held their hands
back and pushed them to their bedroom. Youth B stated the
restraint stopped once Youth B was in their bedroom. Youth B
reported Youth D was in the kitchen and witnessed the restraint.
Youth B stated they were goofing off prior to the restraint trying to
go into the cupboard.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
2, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 1. Youth C
reported Youth B does not like Staff 1 because Staff 1 tells Youth
B what to do. Youth C said, “that is Staff 1’s job and Youth B does
not like it.” Youth C could not recall Staff 1 restraining Youth B.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
March 2, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 1.
Supervisor denied Staff 1 being in a restraint with Youth B in the
kitchen. Supervisor reported Youth B does not like Staff 1
because Staff 1 follows the rules to a “T.” Supervisor stated Youth
B has become really assaultive toward youth and staff and
recently hit staff over the head with a frying pan.
10

Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
14, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 2. Youth D
denied seeing Staff 1 restrain Youth B in the kitchen.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
14, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 2. Staff 3 denied
Staff 1 restraining Youth B in the kitchen.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on March 1,
2023, by just this worker and on March 14, 2023, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker 2. Staff 1 denied restraining
Youth B. Staff 1 reported Youth B was trying to get into the
bottom kitchen cabinet and Staff 1 was concerned Youth B was
going to cut their head on the metal track for the drawer that was
in the cabinet. Staff 1 described kneeling down and putting her
hands out in front of the cabinet to block Youth B from crawling
into the cabinet. Staff 1 stated Youth B hit Staff 1’s hands out of
the way. Staff 1 reported this happened about two to three times.
Staff 1 stated she then stood up, moved behind Youth B, and
cupped her hands on both sides of Youth B’s shoulders and
moved Youth B back about two steps. Staff 1 reported Youth B
then stood up and grabbed the heating element from the stove
and held it above Youth B’s head threatening to hit Staff 1 in the
face. Staff 1 stated this was the only time she touched Youth B.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 1 completed the required Handle with Care
training on 11/28/2022.
• Teaching Family Homes of Upper Michigan Youth Incident
Report dated 02/24/2023 which was consistent with Staff
1’s interview and video footage.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of February 24, 2023, in the kitchen was reviewed.
The kitchen video shows Youth B attempting multiple times to
crawl in the lower kitchen cabinet. Staff 1 can be heard asking
Youth B multiple times to stop because the drawer is off the metal
track and Youth B could cut their head. Staff 1 is seen kneeling
and approximately one minute later is viewed cupping Youth B’s
shoulders from behind and taking two steps back to move Youth B
away from the cabinet. Youth B stands up and grabs the heating
element from the oven, holds it over their head and is heard
threatening Staff 1. Staff 1 is not seen restraining Youth B.
11

Analysis The facility is found in compliance as Staff 1 did not restrain Youth
B. Staff 1 stood behind Youth B, placed her hands on both of
Youth B’s shoulders and slid Youth B back about two steps. Staff
lets go of Youth B’s shoulders and Youth B stands up.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142 Health services; policies and procedures.
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(e) Dispensing medication.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth did not receive their prescribed medication.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
1, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 1. Youth A
reported she did not receive her Lithium the previous morning or
this morning. Youth A stated the facility ran out of the medication.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on March
1, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker 1. Youth B
reported they had not had one of their medications for a few days.
Youth B could not recall the name of the medication but stated it
was red or orange in color. Youth B stated they did not take the
medication because the facility did not order the medication.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on March 1,
2023. Staff 1 reported Youth A missed two doses of Lithium.
Youth A’s evening dose on February 28, 2023, and Youth A’s
morning dose on March 1, 2023. Staff 1 stated the medication
was delivered but the Lithium was not in the box. Staff 1 reported
Staff 2 contacted the doctor. Staff 1 reported Youth B did not get
their prescribed medication on February 27 and 28, 2023. Staff 1
stated Staff 2 contacted the doctor about the medication.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on March 1,
2023, and via telephone on March 17, 2023. Staff 2 reported
when it was determined Youth A and Youth B did not have
enough medication Staff 2 emailed the doctor and the doctor and
her assistant called Staff 2’s personal cell phone to discuss the
medication shortage and fill the prescriptions. Staff 2 stated Youth
A and Youth B’s medication was overlooked by staff and refills
were not requested so both youths did not have their medication.
Staff 2 stated she missed that Youth A needed a refill of Lithium
12

during rounds so did not request a refill. Staff 2 reported she
thought a different staff requested Youth B’s medication be refilled
but that did not happen so therefore Youth B ran out of
medication.
Documents Reviewed:
• Email dated 02/28/23 from Staff 2 to the doctor requesting
Youth A’s refill because it was, “missed during rounds.”
• Email dated 02/22/23 from Staff 2 to the doctor requesting
Youth B’s refill. Email requests refill because Staff 2
thought a different staff requested the medication two
weeks prior but realized that did not happen.
• Email dated 03/01/23 from Staff 2 confirming with the
doctor and her assistance, Youth A’s script was sent in on
02/28/23 to be filled.
• Teaching Family Homes Medication Record for Youth A
and Youth B for February 2023. Youth A was not given
Lithium on February 28, 2023. Youth B was not given
Effexor on February 23 & 24, 2023.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as staff did not request
prescription refills for Youth A and Youth B, causing Youth A and
Youth B to miss two doses of their prescribed medication.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
